definition: to parrot other people's words (idiom); to chime in with others
surname Sui
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
variant of 附[fu4]
to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
old variant of 和[he2]/harmonious
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
old variant of 和[he2]
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"

sentences.english: What he says is ridiculous, yet many people echo his words.
sentences.chinese: 他的讲话真荒唐，但有很多人随声附和。

sentences.english: They echoed every word of their leader.
sentences.chinese: 他们随声附和他们领导人的每句话。

sentences.english: He echoed every word of his superior.
sentences.chinese: 随声附和他上级的每一句话。

sentences.english: “Yeah, the same, ” Matthew echoed, a dim grin on his face.
sentences.chinese: “是啊，一样，”马修随声附和，脸上笑意隐约。

sentences.english: Only my voice took up the tunes, and my heart danced in their cadence.
sentences.chinese: 我只随声附和，我的心应节跳舞。

sentences.english: If Kyl agrees, the majority of the caucus will follow suit.
sentences.chinese: 假如凯尔同意，核心会议的多数人会随声附和。

sentences.english: What he said is ridiculous, but many people echoed his words.
sentences.chinese: 他的讲话真荒唐，但竟然有很多人随声附和。

sentences.english: They echoed every word of their leader .
sentences.chinese: 他们随声附和他们首领的每一句话。

definition: to agree/to go along with/to echo (what sb says)
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to second a motion
to comply in order to please others/to accommodate sb else's taste/to make fun of
to echo one another/to respond (in agreement)
to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
lively discussion with everybody talking at once
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
to answer/to respond/to converse
all of one voice/unanimous
to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
to whisper to one another's ear
to be a yes-man
face light up with delight (idiom); to beam with joy
to flatter/to toady
toady/bootlicker
